biography.value: Fearsome green-skinned giants, trolls eat anything they can catch and devour. Only acid and fire can arrest the regenerative properties of a trollâ€™s flesh.

details.environment: Arctic, Forest, Hill, Mountain, Swamp, Underdark

habitat.custom: Arctic, Forest, Hill, Mountain, Swamp, Underdark

description.value:
The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Keen Smell. The troll has advantage on &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regeneration. The troll regains [[/damage 10 type=heal average=false]] hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes &Reference[acid]{acid} or &Reference[fire]{fire} damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Loathsome Limbs. Whenever the troll takes at least [[/damage 15 slashing average=false]] damage at one time, roll a d20 to determine what else happens to it:

1â€“10: Nothing else happens.

11â€“14: One leg is severed from the troll if it has any legs left.

15â€“18: One arm is severed from the troll if it has any arms left.

19â€“20: The troll is decapitated, but the troll dies only if it canâ€™t regenerate. If it dies, so does the severed head.

If the troll finishes a short or long rest without reattaching a severed limb or head, the part regrows. At that point, the severed part dies. Until then, a severed part acts on the trollâ€™s initiative and has its own action and movement. A severed part has AC 13, 10 hit points, and the trollâ€™s Regeneration trait.

A severed leg is unable to attack and has a speed of 5 feet.

A severed arm has a speed of 5 feet and can make one claw attack on its turn, with disadvantage on the attack roll unless the troll can see the arm and its target. Each time the troll loses an arm, it loses a claw attack.

If its head is severed, the troll loses its bite attack and its body is &Reference[blinded]{blinded} unless the head can see it. The severed head has a speed of 0 feet and the trollâ€™s Keen Smell trait. It can make a bite attack but only against a target in its space.

The trollâ€™s speed is halved if itâ€™s missing a leg. If it loses both legs, it falls &Reference[prone]{prone}. If it has both arms, it can crawl. With only one arm, it can still crawl, but its speed is halved. With no arms or legs, its speed is 0, and it canâ€™t benefit from bonuses to speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
